title: Irish cabinets since 1919
text:
Ireland (and predecessor states).
The <a href="Executive%20%28government%29">executive</a> branch of the modern state of <a href="Republic%20of%20Ireland">Ireland</a> is titled the <a href="Government%20of%20Ireland">Government of Ireland</a>. It has had this title since the <a href="adoption%20of%20the%20Constitution%20of%20Ireland">adoption of the Constitution of Ireland</a> in 1937. The <a href="Ministry%20of%20D%C3%A1il%20%C3%89ireann">Ministry of Dáil Éireann</a> was the <a href="cabinet%20%28government%29">cabinet</a> of the <a href="Irish%20Republic">Irish Republic</a>, from operated from 1919 to 1922. This overlapped with the <a href="Provisional%20Government%20of%20Ireland%20%281922%29">Provisional Government</a> which was put in place after the approval of the <a href="Anglo-Irish%20Treaty">Anglo-Irish Treaty</a> in January 1922. Both these cabinets ceased to operate from December 1922, on the coming into being of the <a href="Irish%20Free%20State">Irish Free State</a>. From 1922 to 1937, the cabinet was known as the <a href="Executive%20Council%20of%20the%20Irish%20Free%20State">Executive Council of the Irish Free State</a>.
Northern Ireland.
The most recently devolved branch of Northern Ireland is known as the <a href="Northern%20Ireland%20Executive">Northern Ireland Executive</a>, established under the <a href="Good%20Friday%20Agreement">Good Friday Agreement</a>. The Executive has been in operation, intermittently, since 1999, and is current operational. Since 1921, <a href="Northern%20Ireland">Northern Ireland</a> has been governed by two other <a href="Devolution">devolved cabinets</a>: <a href="Executive%20Committee%20of%20the%20Privy%20Council%20of%20Northern%20Ireland">Executive Committee of the Privy Council</a> from 1921–72 and the <a href="Executive%20of%20the%201974%20Northern%20Ireland%20Assembly">Northern Ireland Executive</a> of 1974. Northern Ireland has also been governed by <a href="Direct%20rule%20over%20Northern%20Ireland">direct rule</a> from 1972–74, 1974–98 and 2002–07.
